flaws.name: Archaic
flaws.desc: You are stuck in the past and cannot use modern technology

flaws.name: Living in the Past
flaws.desc: You have one or more outdated convictions.

advantages.name: Bond Resistance
advantages.desc: Its easier for you to resist against the effects of a Blood Bond.

advantages.name: Short Bond
advantages.desc: The Bond decays quicker for you.

advantages.name: Unbondable
advantages.desc: You cannot be Blood Bound.

flaws.name: Bondslave
flaws.desc: You bond at the first drink of Vitae.

flaws.name: Bond Junkie
flaws.desc: The Bond feels sweeter to you, and its harder for you to resist its effects.

flaws.name: Long Bond
flaws.desc: The Bond takes more time to decay.

advantages.name: Favored Blood
advantages.desc: You can buy dots in any discipline without tasting the blood of another kindred.

advantages.name: Mark of Caine
advantages.desc: You have a mark that strikes fear in the hearts of Kindred who believe the Myth of Caine. Gain two die bonus to any intimidation tests against these Kindred.

advantages.name: Mockingbird
advantages.desc: After drinking blood from another Kindred you can mimic a discipline of that Kindred up to the level of your highest discipline.

advantages.name: Sun-Scarred
advantages.desc: You have the ability to survive, temporarily, in the sunlight.

advantages.name: Uncle Fangs
advantages.desc: You've taken a small coterie of Thin-Bloods under your wing. Treat them similar to an Ally background.

flaws.name: Befouling Vitae
flaws.desc: Any mortal you attempt to embrace or kill whilst feeding will return as a wight in a few nights.

flaws.name: Clan Curse
flaws.desc: Suffer the Clan Bane of your sire.

flaws.name: Debt Peon
flaws.desc: You owe several minor boons or a major boon to an influential Kindred.

flaws.name: Liquidator
flaws.desc: Local Thin-Bloods are terrified of you, you have a reputation for being a Scourge or hunting them in the past.

flaws.name: Muddled Blood
flaws.desc: Before you can use a discipline, each time you must taste the blood of another Kindred who possesses that discipline.

flaws.name: Walking Omen
flaws.desc: Seers, wise men and other scryers often point to you as a reason for impending doom or disaster.

flaws.name: Word-Scarred
flaws.desc: Part of your body is covered in ancient vampiric lore. Forces within your chronicle conspire to gain access to this text.

advantages.name: Blood Empathy
advantages.desc: You share a closer bond to your domitor than most ghouls, able to sense their emotional and psychological state.

flaws.name: Disease Vector
flaws.desc: Whenever you feed from a sick mortal, you always contract that sickness and will pass it on to your next vessel.

flaws.name: Plaugebringer
flaws.desc: You have a disease in your vitae, at one dot it is something mild like sores or a rash. At two, it can be debilitating. There is no way to cure this. Mortals you feed from are vulnerable to your diseases.

advantages.name: Blood Hound
advantages.desc: You can smell the resonance on your prey without tasting it.

advantages.name: Iron Gullet
advantages.desc: You can feed from rancid, bagged and processed blood.

advantages.name: Vessel Recognition
advantages.desc: You can recognize when a kine belongs to someone elses herd or is a blood doll.

flaws.name: Farmer
flaws.desc: You feed exclusively from animals.

flaws.name: Organovore
flaws.desc: You slake hunger only from eating human flesh.

flaws.name: Methuselah's Thirst
flaws.desc: Your hunger can only be fully slaked by the blood of supernatural creatures.

flaws.name: Prey Exclusion
flaws.desc: You refuse to hunt a certain type of prey, be it women, addicts, homeless.

flaws.name: Vein Tapper
flaws.desc: You cannot feed from mortals while being observed.

advantages.name: Blood Empathy
advantages.desc: You share a closer bond to your domitor than most ghouls, able to sense their emotional and psychological state.

advantages.name: Unseemly Aura
advantages.desc: You have the aura of a Kindred.

flaws.name: Crone's Curse
flaws.desc: When you partook of your domitor's vitae, you aged rapidly.

flaws.name: Distressing Fangs
flaws.desc: The Blood gave you sharpened teeth, which distresses mortals.

advantages.name: Language fluency
advantages.desc: You speak, read and write another language fluently.

flaws.name: Illiterate
flaws.desc: You cannot read or write.

advantages.name: Famous Face
advantages.desc: You resemble someone very well known. You gain two die bonuses in situations where your look-alike helps you, and lose two die when it hurts.

advantages.name: Ingenue
advantages.desc: You look innocent and blameless. Two die bonus to any rolls surrounding avoiding or deflecting blame.

advantages.name: Remarkable Feature
advantages.desc: You have some kind of memorable facial feature. 2 die bonus to social interactions with strangers, 1 die penalty to disguising yourself.

advantages.name: Beautiful
advantages.desc: You are considered beautiful.

advantages.name: Up All Night
advantages.desc: For blush of life, eating and sex act as if your humanity is 1 point higher than it is. DOES NOT COMBINE WITH OTHERS.

advantages.name: Stunning
advantages.desc: You are considered exceptionally good-looking, you turn heads everywhere you go.

advantages.name: Up All Night x2
advantages.desc: For blush of life, eating and sex act as if your humanity is 2 points higher than it is. DOES NOT COMBINE WITH OTHERS.

flaws.name: Stench
flaws.desc: Your breath and odor are exceptionally foul. Lose one die from seduction and similar social tests. Lose two die from stealth tests in which they could smell you.

flaws.name: Transparent
flaws.desc: You are an exceptionally poor liar. Lose one die from any pools requiring subterfuge. You may not gain any further subterfuge dots.

flaws.name: Repulsive
flaws.desc: Your appearance is exceptionally horrifying.

flaws.name: Ugly
flaws.desc: You aren't very good-looking.

advantages.name: Eat food
advantages.desc: You can eat food, though it provides no nourishment and must be expelled before daysleep.

advantages.name: Nuit Mode
advantages.desc: Your body does not automatically revert to the death-state each night allowing you to keep haircuts, tattoos or things like piercings in. Only available while potency is 1 or lower.

advantages.name: Pack Diablerie
advantages.desc: If you attempt a pack diablerie, you are always the one who has the chance to consume the whole soul. If you help another consume a soul, you gain 5 xp.

advantages.name: Cold Dead Hunger
advantages.desc: You've gained mastery over your hunger. Add two die to your rolls to resist hunger frenzy.

advantages.name: Luck of the Devil
advantages.desc: Once per session you can pass an attack, blame or misfortune towards another person present.

flaws.name: Stake Bait
flaws.desc: Being staked brings final death to the vampire

flaws.name: Folkloric Bane
flaws.desc: You take aggravated damage from one folkloric bane, like ultraviolet light, silver or holy water.

flaws.name: Folkloric Block
flaws.desc: You must recoil or spend a willpower when faced with one Folkloric Block, like white animals, running water, garlic, etc.

flaws.name: Starving Decay
flaws.desc: You are constantly fighting off reverting to a corpse. When at hunger 3 or above you visibly decay suffering a two die penalty to all physical and social tests with mortals. MASQUERADE VIOLATION!

flaws.name: Stigmata
flaws.desc: You bleed from your hands, feet and forehead when your hunger becomes intense.

flaws.name: Twice Cursed
flaws.desc: You suffer from a second clan bane. Make note of it on your sheet.

advantages.name: Check the Trunk
advantages.desc: You keep your tools of the trade nearby. You have easy access to a cache of tools or armory not exceeding resources 2.

advantages.name: Side Hustler
advantages.desc: Once per session you can get your hands on a difficult to acquire item, piece of info or access to an event not exceeding Resources, Contacts or Influence 2.

advantages.name: Tempered Will
advantages.desc: You are always aware when someone tries to use Dominate or Presence on you. You gain 2 extra die to resisting these events.

advantages.name: Untouchable
advantages.desc: Once per story you can escape an official punishment from any entity that would normally see you destroyed or exiled. Lower level crimes may be ignored altogether.

flaws.name: Knowledge Hungry
flaws.desc: You are obsessed with learning a certain topic. When you encounter a chance to learn more about that topic, make a willpower roll to resist chasing that obsession.

flaws.name: Prestation Debts
flaws.desc: You owe another Kindred two minor boons.

flaws.name: Risk Taker
flaws.desc: You suffer a two die penalty when you pass up the opportunity to engage in a risky activity like trying a new drug or taking a Kindred lover.

flaws.name: Weak-Willed
flaws.desc: One die penalty to all social pools against anyone you consider a superior or a leader.

advantages.name: Soothed Beast
advantages.desc: Choose an NPC as your obsession, once a session, when in that NPC's presence, you can ignore a bestial fail or messy crit. If the character dies, gain 3 stains and choose a new obsession.

advantages.name: False Love
advantages.desc: Choose an NPC as your obsession, when in that NPC's presence, treat your humanity as 1 point above what it is. DOES NOT COMBINE WITH OTHERS. If the character dies, gain 3 stains and choose a new obsession.

advantages.name: Penitence
advantages.desc: For each dot you possess in this Merit, you can scourge yourself once per session as part of a scene, suffering one point of Superficial Health damage and immediately healing one point of Superficial Willpower damage

advantages.name: Unholy Will (2)
advantages.desc: At two dots, add one die to any dice pool when you resist or contest an individual with true Faith on matters of their faith

advantages.name: Unholy Will (4)
advantages.desc: At four dots, add two die to any dice pool when you resist or contest an individual with true Faith on matters of their faith

advantages.name: Zealotry
advantages.desc: For each dot in this Merit, once per session after rolling a normal success on an action that corresponds to or aligns with one of your Convictions, you may choose to turn that normal success into a messy critical instead.

flaws.name: Beacon of Profanity
flaws.desc: Mortals with any amount of True Faith can sense your presence

flaws.name: Crisis of Faith
flaws.desc: Bestial failures also cause 1 point of superficial WP damage.

flaws.name: Groveling Worm
flaws.desc: You must find time to scourge your flesh at least once per session.

flaws.name: Horrible Scars of Penitence
flaws.desc: Your scars give you away as a crazed zealot.

flaws.name: Living on the Edge
flaws.desc: You suffer a compulsion to always partake of new experiences.

flaws.name: Weak-Willed
flaws.desc: Your will is weak and you struggle assert your own personality when confronted with the will of another.

advantages.name: High-Functioning Addict
advantages.desc: You gain a die to one category of pool whenever you drink from a mortal who is on your drug of choice.

flaws.name: Hopeless Addiction
flaws.desc: Lose 2 die from all pools if you feed from someone not on your drug of choice.

flaws.name: Addiction
flaws.desc: Lose 1 die from all pools if you feed from someone not on your drug of choice.

flaws.name: Two Masters
flaws.desc: You can be blood bound to two separate kindred at once.

advantages.name: Thin-Blood: Anarch Comrades
advantages.desc: You managed to make friends with the local anarch sect. Add a one-dot anarch mawla to your relationship map.

advantages.name: Thin-Blood: Abhorrent Blood
advantages.desc: When another kindred attempts to drink your blood they will find it unpalatable and vomit unless they spend willpower.

advantages.name: Thin-Blood: Camarilla Contact
advantages.desc: You've made a contact within the camarilla who promises you full membership and a chance at becoming full-blooded so long as you follow orders. Add a one-dot camarilla mawla to your relationship map.

advantages.name: Thin-Blood: Catenating Blood
advantages.desc: You can create blood bonds and perform the embrace. Any kindred you create are thin-blooded.

advantages.name: Thin-Blood: Day Drinker
advantages.desc: Sunlight halves your health pool. In the sun you lose access to all vampiric abilities. You still suffer Hunger normally and must sleep occasionally.

advantages.name: Thin-Blood: Discipline Affinity
advantages.desc: You gain a dot in your discipline of choice and can continue to level it with experience as an out-of-clan discipline.

advantages.name: Thin-Blood: Faith-Proof
advantages.desc: You cannot be affected by True Faith.

advantages.name: Thin-Blood: Lifelike
advantages.desc: You have a heartbeat, can eat food and enjoy sex like a mortal. Only detailed examinations would reveal anything out of the ordinary.

advantages.name: Thin-Blood: Low Appetite
advantages.desc: When at hunger 0, 1 or rising for the day roll two die when rousing. If any succeeds you do not gain hunger.

advantages.name: Thin-Blood: Lucid Dreamer
advantages.desc: Once per session, while asleep, you can ask the ST for a hint or clue from the previous night.

advantages.name: Thin-Blood: Mortality's Mien
advantages.desc: Your aura appears mortal to any who care to check.

advantages.name: Thin-Blood: Swift Feeder
advantages.desc: Once per scene you can rapidly slake one point of hunger and cleanly close the wound while feeding.

advantages.name: Thin-Blood: Thin-blood Alchemist
advantages.desc: Gain a dot in Thin-blood alchemy and an additional recipe as discussed with your ST.

advantages.name: Thin-Blood: Vampiric Resilience
advantages.desc: You are as tough as ordinary Kindred, treating puncture and slashing wounds as superficial damage.

flaws.name: Thin-Blood: Baby Teeth
flaws.desc: Your fangs never came in, you can only drink via other methods of blood extraction.

flaws.name: Thin-Blood: Heliophobia
flaws.desc: You fear sunlight like a normal Kindred. You can frenzy from sunlight.

flaws.name: Thin-Blood: Bestial Temper
flaws.desc: You have the same level of beast as a full-blooded kindred. Normal frenzy rules apply to you.

flaws.name: Thin-Blood: Branded by the Camarilla
flaws.desc: Branded by the local camarilla, you are known and watched for even the slightest error.

flaws.name: Thin-Blood: Clan Curse
flaws.desc: You suffer the clan of your choices bane at severity level 1. Brujah/Gangrel only available with Bestial Temper Flaw, Tremere only with Catenating Blood Merit.

flaws.name: Thin-Blood: Mortal Frailty
flaws.desc: You cannot rouse blood to heal like normal Kindred, you heal as a mortal. You cannot take vampiric resilience with this perk.

flaws.name: Thin-Blood: Dead Flesh
flaws.desc: You are noticebly decaying and putrifying. Any real examination will reveal that you are undead. You may not take Lifelike merit.

flaws.name: Thin-Blood: Night Terrors
flaws.desc: Nightmares bleed into your wakening hours appearing as hallucinations or intangible feelings.

flaws.name: Thin-Blood: Plague Bearer
flaws.desc: You are still able to become physically ill. Every time you feed roll, if you land on 1 you have caught an illness.

flaws.name: Thin-Blood: Sloppy Drinker
flaws.desc: Your suck at feeding. Roll Dex + med to cover your feeding marks. A failure may lead to your prey bleeding out.

flaws.name: Thin-Blood: Sun-Faded
flaws.desc: You cannot use any disciplines within the sunlight. Suffer a two die penalty during the day.

flaws.name: Thin-Blood: Supernatural Tell
flaws.desc: Something about you instantly marks you as supernatural to other supernatural beings.

flaws.name: Thin-Blood: Shunned by the Anarchs
flaws.desc: You broke some unwritten rule and pissed off the local anarch sect. You cannot take anarch comrades with this flaw.

flaws.name: Thin-Blood: Twilight Presence
flaws.desc: Mortals and other Kindred dislike you even more than usual. Only other Thin-Bloods tolerate your presence.

flaws.name: Thin-Blood: Unending Hunger
flaws.desc: You sate one less hunger than other thin-bloods whilst feeding.

flaws.name: Thin-Blood: Vitae Dependency
flaws.desc: You must slake at least 1 Hunger on kindred blood each week or lose all access to discipline until you do so.
